file_content.text: You have your droids. I have other assignments from Councillor Belos.
Danison Varik is a genius. You'll need your droids to get past his defenses.
The only way to reach the Empire's droids is by making your own.
Deena Behar? I was told you had some information for me?
Let's talk quickly. Numbers like yours don't escape the Empire's attention for long.
Welcome to Labor Valley, Master Jedi. I won't waste your time.
Major. The Empire has eyes and ears all over Labor Valley, so I'll talk fast.
I've been expecting you, Captain. We might not have another chance, so listen closely.
You already know the Empire's droids are in a secure laboratory. Its toughest defenses are the prison-grade vault doors.
The doors can resist any kind of unauthorized entry--except in an emergency. You'll need disaster relief droids to get inside.
Do you know where I can find these droids?
But I don't have any.
The Empire wouldn't share this information with just anyone.
How did you learn this?
Plenty of Imperials talk when they don't think the Republic is listening.
I'm guessing you can't get these droids in a store.
Never heard of them.
They're only manufactured on Corellia--and they were needed all over the planet when the war came.
What exactly do you do for Councillor Belos again?
You sound like a spy.
Councillor Belos is a busy man. I keep him informed on many issues.
What kind of capabilities do these droids have?
Disaster relief droids?
They're designed to withstand the toughest conditions. They can blast through any door and outlast any turret.
I've broken down plenty of doors on my own.
Is that really necessary?
If those other doors were also blasterproof durasteel with triple-fuse locks, be my guest. Otherwise, these droids are your best bet.
The Beharen Droid Factory specializes in disaster relief droids. They're here in Labor Valley, but they've been closed since the Empire arrived.
The Empire shipped out Beharen's inventory before shutting down the factory. You'll need to get it up and running if you want those droids.
Aren't there any Beharen employees who can help?
Can't the workers do it?
Killed for resisting, like a lot of Labor Valley's workforce. Most factories here are empty.
How do I reactivate an entire factory?
Sounds like quite a job.
I'm here to fight the Empire's droids, not do maintenance.
You're the assistant here.
And I was instructed to tell you how to reach them--not do it for you.
You'll need to restore power by reactivating the factory's off-site generators first, and then start up the assembly line.
There are some risks involved. The generators are located in Hellfire, and rebooting the assembly line will activate any unfinished droids.
What state are these droids actually in?
Define "unfinished."
The droids are missing safety protocols and loyalty programming. They'll fire on you unless they're destroyed.
Do I want to know what Hellfire is?
Hellfire?
Local name for Labor Valley's generators and fuel lines. Half of them are still burning from Republic sabotage and Imperial retaliation.
I know the risks.
Once the assembly line's moving, the factory has to be reconnected to the supply grid.
The machines will get their parts, you'll get your droids, and the droids will get you inside the Empire's lab.
Reactivate the generators, turn on the assembly line, hook up the supply grid.
Let's review this first.
Don't forget avoiding the Empire and any hostile droids.
Sounds clear enough.
When I get to this factory, I better not find an Imperial ambush.
I still don't trust you.
The Imperials will try to stop you, but it won't be because of me, or Councillor Belos.
Once you've hooked up the supply grid, contact me through the factory comm system. That should let me verify that everything's working.
Until then, it's best we don't speak. Good luck.
Do I know you?
